definition: to let (sth happen)/to allow (sb to do sth)/to submit to/to yield
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: If the ball arrives one second beforehand, will you yield it to the wind?
sentences.chinese: 如果球兒提早了一秒飛來，你是否聽任它消逝在風中？

sentences.english: Jack had allowed  himself to become fat.
If swallow, allowing the other side's humiliation, then the prestige of the country?
sentences.chinese: 如果忍氣吞聲，聽任對方的羞辱，那麼國威何在？

sentences.english: The oppressed people will never allow themselves to be preyed upon any longer by others.
sentences.chinese: 被壓迫人民決不聽任其他人再對他們的掠奪。

sentences.english: We are too close to allow success to slip through our fingers.
sentences.chinese: 我們已經如此接近成功，不能聽任它從指縫中溜走。

sentences.english: He allows his children to run wild.
sentences.chinese: 他聽任孩子們亂跑亂鬧，不加管束。

sentences.english: Are we the puppets of fate?
sentences.chinese: 我們是聽任命運擺佈的塊壘嗎？

sentences.english: The oppressed peoples will never allow themselves to be preyed upon by any invaders.
sentences.chinese: 被壓迫民族決不會聽任侵略者肆意掠奪。

sentences.english: The horses also had to lift their feet, tolerate a thermometer inserted into the rectum and more.
sentences.chinese: 馬也必須做擡腳的動作，聽任溫度計插入直腸等等。

sentences.english: Don't toe the line just as it is grotesque , left to the mercy of it.
sentences.chinese: 不要因它怪誕就俯首聽命，聽任它的擺佈。

sentences.english: No erroneous ideas should be allowed to spread unchecked.
sentences.chinese: 不能聽任錯誤思想自由氾濫。

sentences.english: They have surrendered to the struggle of life without complaint.
sentences.chinese: 他們經聽任於生活的艱苦掙扎而不抱怨。

sentences.english: The enemy soldiers fled and let the devil catch the hindmost.
sentences.chinese: 敵兵紛紛逃竄，聽任後面的人遭殃。

sentences.english: You can’t let these kids sit and watch TV all day.
sentences.chinese: 你不能聽任這些孩子整天坐着看電視。

sentences.english: We cannot allow pornographic books to flood the market.
sentences.chinese: 不能聽任黃色書刊充斥市場。

sentences.english: The fact is, they allowed it to happen.
sentences.chinese: 事實是，它們聽任了這一切的發生。
